title: Africa's week in pictures: 20-26 May 2022
description: A selection of the best photos from across Africa and beyond this week.

title: Cost of living crisis: Sheerness cafe owner sleeps on shop floor to save money
description: Steve Jackson skips meals to help pay the rent on his vintage tea shop in Sheerness High Street.

title: The 22-year-old 3D-printing schools
description: Maggie Grout has started an NGO that will 3D-print schools where access to education is not guaranteed.

title: Abba Voyage: The band's virtual concert needs to be seen to be believed
description: All four members appear in public for the first time in 14 years, as they launch their Voyage show.

title: Chris Mason: What was behind Sunak's mini Budget?
description: The chancellor's support package is significant, expensive and has left some of his MPs a bit uncomfortable.

title: Texas shooting victims: Relatives of children speak of their heartbreak
description: Relatives of the children killed in a shooting at a school in Uvalde, Texas speak of their heartbreak.

title: Meghan Markle visits memorial for Texas school shooting victims
description: The Duchess of Sussex laid flowers at the memorial for the 19 children and two adults who died.

title: Russian mum's fight to save sons from Putin's war
description: Marina had no idea when her sons were conscripted that they would be part of an invasion of Ukraine.

title: Every household to get energy bill discounts of £400 this autumn
description: The poorest will also get a lump-sum of £650 to help with the cost of living, Rishi Sunak says.

title: Donbas: Why Russia is trying to capture eastern Ukraine
description: With fighting intensifying in eastern Ukraine, why is the region so essential for Russian success?

title: Quiz of the week: What are Charles and Camilla doing on TV?
description: How closely have you been paying attention to what's been going on over the past seven days?

title: Texas shooting: The teachers who sacrificed their lives to protect children
description: Eva Mireles and Irma Garcia were seen trying to shelter their students from the gunfire.

title: Monkeypox: First case confirmed in Northern Ireland
description: There are 79 cases to date in the UK, according to the PHA, with figures due to be updated later.

title: Northern Ireland Protocol: Stormont recalled after Sinn Féin petition passes
description: The DUP has paralysed the assembly since the election returned Sinn Féin as the largest party.

title: Sue Gray report: More Tory MPs join calls for PM to quit over Partygate
description: But ministers rally round Boris Johnson following Sue Gray's report on Covid rule breaking at No 10.

title: Universal credit fraud costs taxpayers more than £5bn
description: About 13% of universal credit claims were fraudulent, compared with 3% for all benefits.

title: Champions League: Liverpool fan group criticises Uefa over wheelchair spaces at final
description: Uefa's allocation for wheelchair users at the Champions League final "is bordering on exclusion and discrimination", says the Liverpool Disabled Supporters Association.

title: Amanda Reddin: British Gymnastics head national coach steps down with immediate effect
description: British Gymnastics' head national coach Amanda Reddin steps down from the position with immediate effect.

title: French Open: Karolina Pliskova loses in second round to Leolia Jeanjean at Roland Garros
description: Eighth seed Karolina Pliskova suffers a shock exit in the second round of the French Open, losing to world number 227 Leolia Jeanjean.

title: E-scooters: More than 500 injuries recorded in London last year
description: Figures show almost 40% of injuries involving e-scooter incidents in the country were in the capital.

title: Lucy Bronze to leave Manchester City when contract expires this summer
description: England defender Lucy Bronze will leave Manchester City when her contract with the club runs out on 30 June.

title: Billionaire’s stake in BT faces security probe
description: The UK government is using new powers to investigate Patrick Drahi's 18% holding in the telecoms giant.

title: New rules to protect sex assault victims' privacy
description: But campaigners say the changes could backfire and hand private therapy details to attackers.

title: Elvis biopic: Austin Butler praised, but mixed reviews for film
description: Actor Austin Butler is praised, but some critics say he is the "only thing that works" in the film.

title: How can I offer a UK home to Ukrainian refugees?
description: The government has launched two schemes to let Ukrainian refugees come to the UK.

title: Cost of living: 'My daughter won't ask me for money for sanitary products'
description: A mother explains how she can't make ends meet as data suggests more people are struggling.

title: Texas shooting: Police urged to enter school during attack, witnesses say
description: The gunman was inside the Texas school for between 40 minutes and an hour, officials say.

title: Texas shooting: Uvalde tragedy opens painful memories for Sandy Hook parents
description: "Because it is so hauntingly similar to what happened at Sandy Hook School, it hit closer to home."

title: Sasha Johnson: £20,000 reward offered over black rights campaigner shooting
description: A case against four men charged over the attack was dropped in February this year.

title: Man's double hand transplant is 'space-age stuff'
description: Steven Gallagher, 48, has a new lease of life after undergoing pioneering surgery last December.

title: The Unseen Queen: New BBC film shows Royal Family's private family videos
description: An intimate look at family life, the documentary explores unique footage filmed by the Royal Family.

title: Champions League final: Will Real Madrid's Rodrygo haunt Liverpool?
description: How Real Madrid's Champions League star Rodrygo almost joined final opponents Liverpool on the cheap.

title: Venezia FC: Why Italian side are the 'world's most fashionable football club'
description: BBC Sport visits Venezia FC - dubbed "the world's most fashionable football club" by GQ magazine - to learn more about the set of kits that have spread the club's name worldwide.

title: Campaigner and writer Jack Monroe meets food bank users
description: Campaigner and writer Jack Monroe meets food bank users at a centre in Essex.

title: Newspaper headlines: PM 'damaged but unbowed' as Gray report criticises No 10 culture
description: Thursday's front pages appear to be starkly divided over the fallout from Sue Gray's Partygate report.

title: Narva: The Estonian border city where Nato and the EU meet Russia
description: Thousands of Ukrainians have streamed into Narva in Estonia, on the very edge of Nato's eastern flank.

title: Moonage Daydream: David Bowie taught me how to live again, says film-maker
description: Moonage Daydream director Brett Morgen on how David Bowie helped him to recover from a heart attack.

title: Monkeypox: How UK hospitals are tackling the outbreak
description: A network of five specialist NHS hospitals in England is treating some of those infected.

title: The butterflies we may never see again in Britain
description: Scientists warn that 24 of Britain's butterfly species are in danger of dying out.
